Global

Members

styleableTags

A set of tagNames to which a style/class can be styled. If a tagName is not styleable, the styles/classes will be applied to all of its children or the parent depending on the markup.
Source:
  • lib/jquery-extensions/jquery-dom-cleanup.js, line 22

block()

Sizzle lis to find block level elements Usage: - $("body :block") // returns all block elements inside body tag. - $(element).is(":block") // will check if element is block or not.
Source:
  • lib/jquery-extensions/jquery-dom-traversal.js, line 19

blockChildren()

Find all elements that have block level children nodes Usage: $("div").not(":blockChildren") - will return all div elements that don't have block children
Source:
  • lib/jquery-extensions/jquery-dom-traversal.js, line 45

getAllStates(commandNameopt) → {Array.<Object>}

Get an array of all the states found within the current selection (ie: if the current selection has both a bold and a non-bold component, get two results representing that)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
commandName String <optional>
 If provided, only result the state of the given command (ie: fontFamily, bold, etc)
Source:
  • plugins/StateDetector.js, line 98
Returns:
returns array containing an object for each selected node that lists out the commandName and it's value for that node
Type
Array.<Object>

getState(commandNameopt) → {Object}

Same as getAllStates however will only return the states that are applied to every node in the selection
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
commandName String <optional>
 If provided, only result the state of the given command (ie: fontFamily, bold, etc)
Source:
  • plugins/StateDetector.js, line 86
Returns:
returns object containing each commandName and the value only if it is applied to every single node in the selection (if there are multiple nodes in the selection and they have different values for the given command then the value will be false/null)
Type
Object

hasCommandApplied(commandName)

Check if a particular command is applied to the node For example, the nodes ABC or ABC have font-weight command applied and ABC have bold command applied

Name Type Description

hasCommandValue(jNode, options)

Check if a particular style, class, tag is applied to the node
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
jNode
options Set of options for this command
options.className <optional>
 className, (e.g. arte-font-weight)
options.styleName <optional>
 styleName (e.g. font-weight)
options.styleValue <optional>
 styleValue (e.g. bold)
options.tagName <optional>
 tagName (e.g. p or div)
Source:
  • lib/jquery-extensions/jquery-dom-traversal.js, line 238

toggleStyleOnElement(optionsopt)

Toggles styles
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
options Object <optional>
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
element jQuery <optional>
 pass in your own element or use the rich text area by default
styleName Object <optional>
 name of style you would like to toggle on the element (e.g. font-weight)
styleValue Object <optional>
 value for the styleName defined above that you would like to toggle on the element (e.g. bold)
className Object <optional>
 name of css class you would like to toggle on the element (e.g. arte-font-weight)
Source:
  • core/Commands.js, line 232

triggerEvent()

Triggers the event passed in on the contentEditable element with data provided

Get or Set innerHtml of the contentEditable element
Source:
  • core/TextArea.js, line 180
Returns:
returns 'innerHTML' of the contentEditable element if in rich text mode or 'value' of the element if in plaintext mode if getting value, otherwise returns nothing
Type
string

wrapWithBlock()

Surround a set of nodes with a block element. If a block parent exist, apply the styles to the existing block if there are attributes, or update the tagName of the block parent.
Source:
  • lib/jquery-extensions/jquery-dom-manipulation.js, line 96
